Title: India - Group Manager - Transactional Quality
Text:
Company Description
WNS (Holdings) Limited (NYSE: WNS), is a leading Business Process Management (BPM) company. We combine our deep industry knowledge with technology and analytics expertise to co-create innovative, digital-led transformational solutions with clients across 10 industries. We enable businesses in Travel, Insurance, Banking and Financial Services, Manufacturing, Retail and Consumer Packaged Goods, Shipping and Logistics, Healthcare, and Utilities to re-imagine their digital future and transform their outcomes with operational excellence.

We deliver an entire spectrum of BPM services in finance and accounting, procurement, customer interaction services and human resources leveraging collaborative models that are tailored to address the unique business challenges of each client. We co-create and execute the future vision of 400+ clients with the help of our 44,000+ employees. Our global footprint spans 16 countries with 61 delivery centers worldwide including in China, Costa Rica, India, the Philippines, Poland, Romania, South Africa, Spain, Sri Lanka, Turkey, United Kingdom and the United States.

Job Description
The Incumbent will be responsible to:-
Provides day-to-day direction to Lead Associates.
Coordinates with all departments to ensure that the Quality Targets are met.
Designs the Quality Management System that standardizes and documents all processes.
Ensures compliance to contractual deliverables and address team-level issues.
Implement initiatives and projects as needed in order to drive performance.
Ensures that SLAs in Quality are met.
Supervise Assistant Managers – Quality.
Designs and drives KPIs and KRAs of the team.
Coordinates with all departments in implementing Quality Programs.
Conduct RCA for challenged metrics.
Produce Reports as needed.
Keep trackers, ISO documents and other account files updated.
Conducts projects to improve performance.
Develops plans to minimize cost and increase productivity.
Plans for manpower requirements and implemented right sizing of the department when needed.
Creates process documentation and standardizes processes of quality.
Conduct trainings for quality as needed.
Develop the quality team in accordance to the quality roadmap.
Perform other duties that may be assigned from time to time.

Qualifications
Any Graduate/PG.
Candidates with FNA domain expertise in AP/AR – Mandatory.
Must have at least 5 years of work experience in Quality.
Must have at least 3 years’ experience as a QA Manager/Team Lead.
Must have excellent English communication and writing skills.
Must be proficient in MS Office.

Additional Information
Shifts: - Monday to Friday - 5.00 PM to 2.00 AM Bracket.
Role: - Client Facing - Team Role - 6/7 QA would report to the Manager.
Process: - Back Office – FNA
Certifications: - Green Belt Certified Preferred, however not mandatory.
Location: - Pune

Title: Head of Data Management
Text:
70 tactical buyers are supporting both commercial and NTO towers out of Prague NGSC, covering region Europe, Switzerland, Middle East and North Africa.
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE, BUT NOT LIMITED TO:
Translates global divisional category strategy into global, divisional, sub category strategy OR translates regional procurement strategy into country strategy and local implementation.
Lead the implementation of sourcing plans for the sub-category and deliver sub-category savings targets following engagement in the target setting process.
Provide input into the overall Category or sub-category strategy about segmentation and identification of key supplier relationships, and lead business planning activities and ensure these projects are staffed and executed on a timely basis in line with the targeted goals.
Manage strategic sub-category supplier relationships, and implement consistent key performance indicators for the sub-category, ensuring that any supplier performance risks and issues are resolved on a timely basis to end-user satisfaction.
May directly control at a country level purchases with respect to supplier choice, timing and commercial conditions (may vary between divisions depending on way spend is controlled).
Collect supplier information and feedback from Divisions, countries, sites, Category teams and Business Partners, and deliver Procurement Balanced Scorecard metrics for the relevant sub-category.
Create, apply, complete and reviews major contracts for the sub-category, and ensure that negotiated contracts are clearly communicated for the sub-category area and that they are consistently applied [Cross-Divisional/Pharma spend $25 -$100m NCH/SDZ/NVD/NIBR spend $20 -$80m].
Manage the performance and talent development of direct reports and contribute to talent development of indirect reports (Direct reports 5 -10 or indirect reports up to 30) & Manage the budget/resource allocation for the area of responsibility.

Minimum requirements
Degree required: BS/MS Computer Science & 8 -10 years proven experience in data management & data strategy.

Hands on experience with handling Data Science Enablement related activities across many of data domains.

Leadership of use case based agile implementation of data strategy in cross-organizational and cross-functional teams.

Proven track record in implementing a Data Science Enablement program from scratch in Pharma or other multinational, multi-business organizations

General understanding of data driven strategies, data management activities & Ability to build and handle digital data management capabilities & Advance knowledge of data Visualization tools and techniques & Expertise in Descriptive, Inquisitive, and Predictive analytics.

Deep understanding of data science workflow and efficiency issues related to data availability, quality and productizing data science. Ability to code in R & Working knowledge of Cognitive Analytics and Robotics Automation.

Why consider Novartis?
799 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2019. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Title: Engagement Manager: Digital Innovation and Prototyping
Text:
Bachelors, Masters or Ph.D. in Engineering, Computer Science or other relatable technical discipline
7+ years experience in software, hardware or integrated systems design and delivery
5+ years of proven experience in delivering highly complex, cross functional, multi-discipline technology or engineering programs
3+ years of demonstrable experience using modern agile development and delivery methodologies
Demonstrable track record of success driving adoption of disruptive technologies across at least 3 diverse industries or verticals
Strong verbal and written communications skills.

The Prototype Engagement Manager (PEM) collaborates with Prototyping Architects (PA) to qualify and deliver complex multi-week customer engagements as well as ensure a consistent handling of the prototyping results after the engagement has finished. As such, the PEM has the following main responsibilities:
Proactively identify prototyping opportunities with customers, account teams and BD. Ideally, PEMs dive deep to understand the customer's business as well as their technical architecture to identify opportunities or gaps that require use of emerging services.
Establish the scope and define a working setup in collaboration with technical as well as business stakeholders of a prototype. This includes work on feasibility studies as well as driving the business aspect of a potential prototyping result. This also includes qualifying engagement to ensure that the investment of an engagement is likely to return a positive business result in the long run for the customer and Amazon.
Execute prototyping engagements in collaboration with Prototyping architects and the account teams. This execution phase as well as all other phases of prototyping include hands-on technical work with architecture teams, service teams and PAs to develop working, production-scale prototypes with customers. Hence, PEMs have to directly contribute to customer solutions and continuously learn capabilities of existing or new services.
Capture learnings as well as customer feedback from engagements and drive those learnings into the wider organization to improve services and products. PEMs also participate in awareness campaigns as well as spreading technical as well as procedural know-how derived from their engagements internally as well as other customers.
Working alongside Prototyping Engineers and Solutions Architecture leadership, support customers in the exploration, ideation, engineering and delivery of leading edge cloud based innovation across an extensive breadth of technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Big Data, Analytics, Internet of Things, computer vision and augmented/virtual reality
Qualify, execute and deliver strategic innovation and prototyping outcomes for a range of customers across a broad range of industries and verticals
Create, articulate, and position an innovative and compelling vision and value proposition such that customers realize the financial, technological and transformational value of innovating, prototyping and engineering on the AWS platform
Help customers structure their technical and organizational resources to ensure the maximum benefit can be derived from innovation, prototyping and the adoption of the AWS cloud
develop extensive executive and senior technical relationships within client organizations; being viewed as a trusted advisor for innovation and cloud technology
PEMs identify opportunities for complex on-site engagements with customers and then execute them end-to-end in collaboration with all parts of the organization, particularly the PAs and SAs. The PEM shows aptitude in working with customer business stakeholders of all levels as well as their senior technical staff during the inception as well as the execution of a prototyping engagement without supervision or guidance. As such, the PEM plays a vital interfacing role between the customer and other parts of the organization such as service or marketing teams. Additionally, a PEM should participate in activities around sharing best practices, evangelism, generating technical content etc. to help scale the organization as a whole. This includes authoring presentations, demos, workshops for internal and external use.

Bachelors, Masters or Ph.D. in Engineering, Computer Science or other relatable technical discipline
7+ year’s experience in software, hardware or integrated systems design and delivery
5+ years of proven experience in delivering highly complex, cross functional, multi-discipline technology or engineering programs
3+ years of demonstrable experience using modern agile development and delivery methodologies
Demonstrable track record of success driving adoption of disruptive technologies across at least 3 diverse industries or verticals
Strong verbal and written communications skills.

Title: Principal Product Manager (Azure)
Text:
Are you interested in working for one of the most exciting teams in Microsoft? A team relentlessly focused on customer needs and advancing Microsoft Cloud first strategy? Interested in a start-up like environment, passionate about Cloud Computing technology and driving growth in one of Microsoft’s core businesses? Then look no further than the Azure Global Team!
Azure is the fastest-growing business in Microsoft’s history and is the foundation of Microsoft’s commercial Cloud Services. Azure differentiates itself as the only hyper-scale, enterprise-grade Cloud that has a true hybrid story. Building on Azure’s success as a horizontal platform, Azure Global is driving industry-specific conversations with our customers helping them digitally transform their vertically specialized customer experiences, operational processes, products, and partners.
We are seeking team players that will define and build the common foundation for industry solutions. This horizontal foundation will enable Azure customers reduce time to market and ensure customer delight. We have a startup culture - dreaming big, working hands-on with customers, and daring to build something that has never been built before. Our team applies cutting edge big data and analytics technology, machine learning and high-end services to solve real world problem.
Responsibilities
This position will drive GTM for Azure for the Agriculture Industry. You will be responsible for understanding, prioritizing, and driving customer requirements across engineering; getting the right partners engaged to build an ecosystem. You will work directly with some of the largest and most innovative companies in the Agriculture value chain to help create repeatable & scalable solutions around the hardest industry problems using the unique power of Azure.
You will need to deeply understand the state of Agriculture in North America & LATAM, build strong relationships in the industry, and know how to influence policy. Working directly with both customer and engineering leaders alike, this role presents an opportunity to have a tangible impact on our cloud products and strategy, as well as fuel our customers’ success. Key areas of ownership would be:
Drive Depth Customer Engagements
Orchestrate the adoption of Azure and our industry platforms (e.g. FarmBeats, Blockchain, Azure Collaborative Workbench) within select strategic accounts in collaboration with Engineering, Business Development & Sales teams.
Help build/influence the solution architecture leveraging our Industry platform/stack
Build and program manage the execution plan to a specific timeline
Platform Partnerships
Collaborate with Engineering, Business Development & Industry Sales teams to land strategic partnerships with customers and ISVs (Independent Software Vendors) to scale adoption of our platform as well as co-build/co-innovation scenarios
Engage with Business Development & Partner teams to enable co-sell & new monetization opportunities

Long Range Planning
Build strong industry domain expertise that informs our long-term industry platform strategy. Bring “outside-in” perspective/customer/partner voice into planning
Engage with Industry & Business Development teams to build a robust view of the addressable market opportunity for MSFT
Collaborate with Engineering to build technical long-range plans.
Field & Partner Enablement
Collaborate with Engineering & Sales teams to identify & land the right customers for pilots and depth engagements.
Enable/train field teams to engage customer and partner ecosystem.
Land playbooks & pitch collateral with depth & scale solution references/cases for industry leading customer & ISVs
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
10+ years of relevant experience in Product Management (building and shipping products)
Experience working with strategic customers at the C-Suite level to drive strategic partnerships and translating this across the Microsoft ecosystem. Excellent at interfacing with customers, and a strong desire to help them succeed
A structural, repeatable approach in solving complex problems, the ability communicate to senior decision makers in a clear, compelling way, and drive decisive action in partnership with others in a large, matrixed organization.
Demonstrated ability to translate business requirements, scenarios into products and services, ability to own and to deliver results.
Stellar cross-group collaboration with the ability to drive decisive action in large enterprises
Exceptional communication, leadership and influencing skills. Ability to work independently in highly ambiguous environments, with both technical and business groups internally and externally.
MBA and/or experience in specific industry domains such as Agriculture, Blockchain will be an added plus
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.
These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country.

Title: Senior Brand Manager

Title: Vice President - Finance Digitization
Text:

Reporting, Planning & Analysis
Performance and Analytics
Business Decision Support

The incumbent with be the primary Finance business partner for all of “Information & Systems” and AUM. The incumbent will work closely with local, central SSGA and State Street Corporate Finance teams to ensure all aspects of the Financial Processes are operating efficiently and effectively. The incumbent will lead and manage the teams responsible for the operations, development and maintenance of SSGA’s Financial Data Warehouse and associated Business Intelligence applications. These teams maintain and operate the current systems and applications, determine and develop new applications and provide data and process knowledge expertise to the Finance community as well as other non- Finance teams.
The incumbent should have a varied background within the investment management industry which integrates Finance Process, Financial Planning and Analysis, Management Reporting, Project Management and IT Development. The position requires excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interface successfully with senior management positions.
Major responsibilities to include:
Lead the development of data visualization tools for senior management- Tableau, Spotfire, Alteryx, etc.,
Lead Finance development efforts regarding business intelligence applications and data
Identify and evaluate opportunities to improve efficiency or decision support intelligence through automation or development projects
Lead Finance product profitability unit (CAPS), to fully maximize channel, client and product profitability tool. Continuously improve cost and profitability analytics
Lead Product Master (Finance) application and continue to leverage it for betterment of reporting to Senior Leadership.
Lead and Support Pricing and BAC efforts including Product development and new product launches.
Lead AUM function in India and collaborate with Business location to ensure accuracy of the reports.
Lead and act as PoC for all interactions with IT teams in ensuring the projects are prioritized, deployments are properly monitored and documented, go-live is managed to meet organizational objectives. This includes; Analyzing and identifying development priorities, Preparing detailed and accurate business requirements, Developing and implementing effective business acceptance testing programs, Ensuring timely completion of development projects.
Consistently engage at all levels as a senior expert from a functional, organizational and business context expert.
Must have excellent understanding and command of various data structure, process knowledge and contextual understanding.
Must have extensive experience in building and maintaining key Finance applications as part of a Global team. Must have a strong understanding of the business across all its levels.
Strategic Analysis and decision support to the business/functional heads. Must possess outstanding analysis and insight skills.
Analyzing and forecasting financial risks and opportunities vis-à-vis Budgets, Forecasts and Plans; active and creative cost allocation methodologies.
Prepare and/or oversee the preparation of analysis, commentary and presentation material for Financial review with senior management
Maintain relationships and oversight of finance support teams to ensure quality deliverables and proper information flow.
Work with business leaders to analyze market, competitor and regulatory landscape, including key trends and report on key market competitiveness metrics
Development of financial analytical models
Support business development, M&A type analysis / assessments and related activities to include post-mortem ROI analysis
Play a critical role in developing the talent pool. Must be a key advisor, coach and trainer for the team.
Requirements
15 years’ plus experience within Financial Planning and Analysis; Be extremely comfortable in accepting for self and providing challenge to the team.
Financial Services experienced required, Investment Management industry preferred.
MBA/CFA/CPA/CMA/ACCA/CA – preferably Business analysis and project management background with extremely thorough, precise and documentation oriented.
Strong technical skills including MS Office, data visualization required (preference for experience in one or all of VBA, Essbase, SmartView, Oracle Tableau and Alteryx)
Detail oriented, well organized, high standards of accuracy and precision;
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to prioritize conflicting priorities. Ability to interact with and manage expectations of Senior Management.
Enquiring mind, curious with solid problem-solving skills and excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Must be able to shift easily between individual and team-oriented deliverables and groups, be a strong team player, leader and client focused individual.
Must be flexible in addressing onshore/offshore time zone.

Title: Tech Bus Services Manager
Text:
About Wells Fargo

Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading global financial services company headquartered in San Francisco (United States). Wells Fargo has offices in over 30 countries and territories. Our business outside of the U.S. mostly focuses on providing banking services for large corporate, government and financial institution clients. We have worldwide expertise and services to help our customers improve earnings, manage risk, and develop opportunities in the global marketplace. Our global reach offers many opportunities for you to develop a career with Wells Fargo. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you will feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. We are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Market Job Description

About Wells Fargo India
& Philippines (WFIP)
WFIP enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and Knowledge Services. Wells Fargo India & Philippines operates in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai in India and in Manila, Philippines. Learn more about WFIP at our International Careers website.
Department Overview

The Office of the Head of Technology (OHoT) team supports Technology and enables the organization to provide a competitive advantage for Wells Fargo. This support includes developing the technology strategy and monitoring its execution, Technology Business Services, Analytics and Business Intelligence, Global Solution Program Office, Third Party Operations and Vendor Governance.
About the Role

This position is part of technology business services team and will be responsible for leading RRP and iNPS Operations for Wells Fargo Technology (WFT). This is a new role and will be part of a central team that supports Recovery and Resolution planning activities and implementation of an Internal Net Promoter Score (iNPS) System for Wells Fargo Technology.
Responsibilities

Provides support for technology aspects of the Company's Recovery and Resolution Plans.
Includes coordinating the technology oversight of the Company's Management Information Systems capability, recovery and resolution planning activities, facilitating cross-functional dialogue and providing a central point of contact for risks and issues.
Promoting the integration of recovery and resolution related processes into BAU processes. Engaging with all lines of defense to challenge and improve technology recovery and resolution planning activities (including narratives, playbooks, and assumptions.)
Support Critical Reports Inventory capability and Key Role Refresh Process. Provide analysis on Use & Access to Technology impacted applications and regression testing artifact collection.
Monitor a status dashboard on a recurring basis, report to Technology RRP leadership. Evaluate the dashboard for exceptions – application health indicators that need remediation. Is capable of developing SharePoint workflows to capture key information through forms and automated process flows including approvals.
Acting as liaison for WFT groups supporting implementation activities including design and closed feedback loop systems
Working with the WFT groups to create survey requirements, reporting and dashboards related to each group's specific iNPS needs
Provides leadership in the management of relationships and implementation of services/initiatives with cross-functional business partners.
Support the leadership with various processes, coordination tasks, tools, data tracking and maintenance as appropriate.

Essential Qualifications:

Bachelors/master's degree with overall 15+ years of technology delivery and relationship management experience.
Risk and Regulatory reporting activities, manage dashboards and executive reporting.
Fair knowledge on business process management and enterprise organizations and functions.
Strong experience in understanding the Application inventory management and dependencies
Experience with analytics and reporting tools (Tableau, Power BI), communication products (SharePoint, Confluence), Microsoft office and/or other productivity tools
Demonstrate strong leadership and communication skills.


Leadership Expectations at Wells Fargo

As a Team Member manager, you are expected to achieve success by leading yourself, your team, and the business. Specifically you will:
Lead your team with integrity and create an environment where your team members feel included, valued, and supported to do work that energizes them.
Accomplish management responsibilities which include sourcing and hiring talented team members, providing ongoing coaching and feedback, recognizing and developing team members, identifying and managing risks, and completing daily management tasks.

We Value Diversity

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other status protected by applicable law. We comply with all applicable laws in every jurisdiction in which we operate.

Title: Digital Marketing Manager
Text:
About Byte Academy
Byte Academy is a leader in industry-oriented education with courses in FinTech (Financial Technology), Python software development, and Data Science. Byte Academy established the first FinTech program in the world and the first Python full-stack software development Bootcamp in New York City. Career services and local and global community development are key to achieving Byte’s goals. Our hiring and community partners in the US include Microsoft, Google, JP Morgan, Twilio, Morningstar, and IBM, in addition to startups and incubators. Byte has brought thousands together from diverse backgrounds via its hackathons, conferences, founders’ talks, meetups, and other events. Apart from New York, it has branches in Houston, Bangalore, and Mumbai, Byte Academy delivers its programs both in offline as well as online modes.
Job Brief
Byte Academy is looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic individual to join the marketing team. If you live and breathe digital marketing, we want to talk to you. In order to help grow our business both in the US as well as in India, we are looking for a Digital Marketing Manager to develop, implement, track and optimize our digital marketing campaigns across all digital channels.
You should have a strong grasp of current marketing tools and strategies and be able to lead integrated digital marketing campaigns from concept to execution. You will work with the marketing team, technical and support teams to launch campaigns on time and on budget.
*Responsibilities
Plan and execute all digital marketing, including SEO/SEM, email, social media, lead forms and display advertising campaigns
Design, build and maintain our social media presence
Measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs)
Identify trends and insights, and optimize spend and performance based on the insights
Brainstorm new and creative growth strategies
Plan, execute and measure experiments and conversion tests
Collaborate with internal teams to create landing pages and optimize the user experience
Utilize the strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touchpoints
Instrument conversion points and optimize user funnels
Collaborate with agencies and other advertising partners
Evaluate emerging technologies. Provide thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate
Requirements
Engineer / MBA degree with 3-5 years of experience in marketing or a related field
Proven working experience in the digital marketing space
Demonstrable experience leading and managing SEO/SEM, email, social media, lead forms, and/or display advertising campaigns
Highly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns that engage, inform and motivate
Solid knowledge of website analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Hubspot)
Experience in optimizing landing pages and user funnels
Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments
Experience in setting up and optimizing Google Adwords and Facebook Ad campaigns
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints
Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking
Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurement
Compensation
Best in the industry, compensation will not be a constraining factor.
*

Expected Start Date: 21/9/2020

Title: Technical Product Manager-3
Text:
About Role:
As a Technical Product Manager in Credit Risk and collections team, You will be responsible for building scalable platforms for credit risk and collections that enables growth/drive revenue while keeping the losses flat
The ideal candidate is expected to
Understand business needs, end to end customer experiences when building platform solutions.
Understanding of business centric measurement (conversions/retention, funnels, user journeys) will be a big plus
Understanding of lending industry will be a plus
Ability to work with large amounts of data: facts, figures, and number crunching.
Ability to work independently, at times with minimal guidance and ambiguous data to create actionable insights
Job Description – Roles and Responsibilities
Define product requirements and lead successful execution of initiatives
Engage closely with engineering and architecture in Agile methodology to help determine the best technical implementation/design while balancing time-to-market needs.
Partner with cross-functional teams at PayPal and external partners to design, build, launch, and market new payment capabilities
Use A/B Testing, analytics, market research, usability studies, and competitive analysis to drive decision making
Define and proactively monitor key performance metrics to support and inform product decisions. Engage in problem solving with analytics to determine trends and root causes.
Partner with Customer Support teams in solving pain points for our users.
Partner with Legal, Privacy, and Compliance teams to ensure the products we deliver are within regulatory boundaries.
Define a product launch plan for your area, including identifying new opportunities as well as maintaining a rolling marketing roadmap of projects or iterations.
Minimum Required Skills/Qualifications:
Minimum of a BE is required, MBA or MS preferred
Minimum 3 years of experience dealing with technical problem solutions as a product manager.
Proven track record for building, launching, and maintaining high-scale, successful products
Excellent communication and presentation skills – written and verbal
Innovative, entrepreneurial, ability to multi-task
Highly motivated, goal driven, Can-do approach, curious and open minded
Tech savvy which loves to stay on top of industry trend
Job_Description_Summary: Credit Risk and collection teams will be responsible for entire risk lifecycle of the PP Credit products that we offer to Consumers and Merchants. It starts with assessing the Credit worthiness of the Customer when they apply for Credit products to final phase of Collections if they go delinquent.
Who we are: Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 286 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.
We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.
PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Title: Senior Product Manager (Azure)
Text:
Are you interested in working for one of the most exciting teams in Microsoft? A team relentlessly focused on customer needs and advancing Microsoft Cloud first strategy? Interested in a start-up like environment, passionate about Cloud Computing technology and driving growth in one of Microsoft’s core businesses? Then look no further than the Azure Global Team!
Azure is the fastest-growing business in Microsoft’s history and is the foundation of Microsoft’s commercial Cloud Services. Azure differentiates itself as the only hyper-scale, enterprise-grade Cloud that has a true hybrid story. Building on Azure’s success as a horizontal platform, Azure Global is driving industry-specific conversations with our customers helping them digitally transform their vertically specialized customer experiences, operational processes, products, and partners.
We are seeking team players that will define and build the common foundation for various industries. This horizontal foundation will enable Azure customers reduce time to market and ensure customer delight. We have a startup culture - dreaming big, working hands-on with customers, and daring to build something that has never been built before. Our team applies cutting edge big data and analytics technology, multiparty governance, machine learning and high-end services to solve real world problems.
Responsibilities
As a PM you need to
Define and own the required product roadmap based on the market landscape, competition, industry trend, telemetry insights, etc. and arrive at an execution plan for prioritized list of investments.
Evangelize the assigned Azure service to customers and contribute to various marketing initiatives like blogs, documentation, videos, running customer testimonials, representing in Ignite, Inspire, MVP summits, etc.
Write detailed functional specifications, that captures technical details, user experience, supportability aspects, scale and performance goals, prioritization and scoping of any features.
Work with internal and external partners to gather feedback, manage dependencies
Track closely the changes in the market, industry landscape, technology trends and competition.
Effectively facilitate org-wide reviews and meetings.
Ensure customer success for all customers, working closely with key customers
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
7+ years of relevant experience in Product Management (building and shipping products)
Excellent at interfacing with customers, and a strong desire to help them succeed
Demonstrated ability to translate business requirements to product specifications and deliver results in an environment of ambiguity
Stellar cross-group collaboration with the ability to drive decisive action in large enterprises
Exceptional communication, strong leadership and influencing skills
MBA and/or experience in specific industry domains such as retail, finance, blockchain will be an added plus
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Title: Group Manager - FP&A (Corporate Finance)
Text:
Company Description
WNS (Holdings) Limited (NYSE: WNS), is a leading Business Process Management (BPM) company. We combine our deep industry knowledge with technology and analytics expertise to co-create innovative, digital-led transformational solutions with clients across 10 industries. We enable businesses in Travel, Insurance, Banking and Financial Services, Manufacturing, Retail and Consumer Packaged Goods, Shipping and Logistics, Healthcare, and Utilities to re-imagine their digital future and transform their outcomes with operational excellence.

We deliver an entire spectrum of BPM services in finance and accounting, procurement, customer interaction services and human resources leveraging collaborative models that are tailored to address the unique business challenges of each client. We co-create and execute the future vision of 400+ clients with the help of our 44,000+ employees. Our global footprint spans 16 countries with 61 delivery centers worldwide including in China, Costa Rica, India, the Philippines, Poland, Romania, South Africa, Spain, Sri Lanka, Turkey, United Kingdom and the United States.

Job Description
Principal Responsibilities:
1. Monitoring BU P&L against agreed targets
2. Analysis of MIS and key operational parameters – including reviews with business head
3. P&L analysis at vertical, horizontal, location and client level
4. Strong communication for discussion with the leaders in the WNS like Process head / Business Unit Head, Operation Head etc.
5. Driving the annual budgeting exercise and ensuring budgetary controls in place through the year in line with budgets in close coordination with Operations and corporate teams.
6. Revenue assurance as per IFRS and commercials agreed with the customers.
7. Process wise P&L forecasting on monthly basis.
8. Monthly and quarterly closing as per IFRS.
9. Compliance of commercial clauses agreed in the customer contracts.

11. Tracking Operating metrics- headcount, seats, SU, attrition etc.
12. Suggest cost saving measures.
13. Work with operations lead to achieve targets.
14. Pricing
15. Finance support to functions- BU Head, Operations, HR, Sales etc.
16. Automation initiatives

Critical Skills required:
1. 5-6 years of working experience in BP&M processes such as Budgeting and forecasting, Management reporting, Flash Reports.
2. 5-6 years of experience in BPO industry
3. Exposure to ERP
4. Good communication and interpersonal skills
5. Good presentation skill
6. Advance Excel

Qualifications
Qualified CA/ICWA/MBA with post qualification 5-6 years in FP&A

Additional Information
Good understanding of Budgeting / Forecasting / P&L Analysis / Estimate / Revenue Pipeline

Title: DeputyManager, Operational Finance
Text:
Flexible Work Eligible: Flexible Work Schedule
DISCOVER your opportunity

What will your essential responsibilities include?
Finance Operations Data team (called FinOps Data) is responsible for managing the Data Confirming Layer (called CL) which is the home to entire technical data of our Insurance segment. This is a point where all data gets interfaced from various source systems which includes policy level details, is then confirmed into financial codes. The key responsibility is to ensure that all Insurance data is mapping into correct financial codes, therefore maintaining the mappings as most accurate is highly crucial. The team performs Financial Data Analysis, very complex reconciliations, Data Quality Control and manages change requests from across the organization. The team also coordinates with Actuaries, Finance, IT, Tax and Insurance Operations team regularly for various subjects. The team also performs detailed data analysis, clean ups, source to financial reconciliations and support various projects for changes / enhancements or deployment of new systems.
What will your essential responsibilities include?
Financial Data Analysis and Reconciliations:
Monitor balances and control reports, perform complex reconciliations, identify variances and work with Finance & IT to resolve issues as needed.
Analyse any Finance Data irregularities and coordinate solution with other Finance Operation teams and other EE teams.
Develop as a Finance Data expert to provide extended support to various global stakeholders for any adhoc requests. Investigate any complex issues from Stakeholder and work with Data team to derive solutions.
Prepare Source to Conforming Layer data reconciliations and publish results as requested.
Provide support to Manager for any Internal or External Audit questions and queries.
Data Quality Control:
Review Data mappings between assigned source systems and conforming layer (CL) to meet the data needs of the EE platform.
Coordinate with Global stakeholders i.e. Business Partners, Finance Operations, Master Data Management (MDM) for testing and implementation of recommended mappings.
Support Finance, Tax and other stakeholders to prepare fixes for any variances and/or alignment of historical data due to change of mapping.
Ensure data related control processes are adhered to and make recommendations for improvements in Data.
Support the Financial Cubes reconciliaions before publishing to Stakeholders.
Change Management, Project Support and Ad-hoc activities:
Support conversion/Integration activities, perform Finance impact assessment and work with different teams for any data clean-up projects.
Work on changes requested by Finance or Business Partners in Conforming Layer / Mappings and provide complete financial analysis and impact assessment.
Support business specification development for any new system deployment and/or enhancements to existing systems.
Perform User and/or Business Validation Testing (UAT/BVT). Includes extraction of data, review results during vairous stages i.e. DEV, UAT, BVT and document results and provide / cordinate sign-off’s.
Month/Quarter/Year Close support:
Support periodic close activities, manage/work on ad-hoc requests and perform end to end investigations for the close.
Prepare data to support finance journals to fix any data/reconciliations issues.
Support Lloyds reporting and actively participate on the Lloyds reporting needs or emergency extract and reconciliaion of Data from Conformance Layer. Help to generate End to End reconciliaions.
SHARE your talent

We’re looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:
A Finance professional with a related degree (Bachlors / Masters / Qualified Accountants / Btech)
Worked for a minimum of 5+ years in a global Banking / Finance / Insurance company.
Lloyds Of London Syndicate Insurance knowledge is preferable.
Have a good knowledge of financial statements and an exposure to Complex Data reconciliations.

Title: Programmatic Trader
Text:
Job Summary
The Programmatic Trader is responsible for the planning, setup and execution of audience targeted campaigns in accordance with the strategy and objective of our clients. The ideal candidate is a specialist in using multiple interfaces, in a self-service capacity, to discover audiences and target them via media buying tools (DSPs) across various channels. Campaigns need to be maintained and optimized frequently to achieve KPI goals and deliver completely. Collaborate with the team for support and promote knowledge sharing.
Duties & Responsibilities
Build a great working relationship with digital teams, operating seamlessly together to deliver success for our esteemed clients, across briefing, strategy, set up, optimization, reporting processes & invoicing.
Be the support to the teams in advocating good practice, challenging the status quo and identifying opportunities to improve the way we work.
Consistently learn from the people leading the digital ad revolution.
Gain an in-depth understanding of the programmatic landscape.
Work with the sales team to implement and oversee ad campaigns across different platforms.
Be trained on the various platforms & tools and how insight and analytics fits into the larger team.
Assist in the day-to-day operations of the operations team and take ownership of pre-campaign to post-campaign requirements.
Manage and be responsible for all the campaigns from start to completion.
Generate meaningful insights for post-campaign reporting.
Incorporate and recommend other aspects of the business including audience planning and insight, products and proprietary media as part of the overall campaign execution.
Consistently manage and deliver campaigns through your portfolio of our customers, with the highest degree of service, strongest results and without error.
Share your strong programmatic media knowledge through facilitating training sessions with your peers and providing in-depth media strategies within your expertise.
Seek opportunities to not only grow and develop client campaigns, but look for ways to improve the existing products used by customers.
Handle online advertiser & publisher queries and internal sales requests.
Manage advertiser budget and bid setup.
Perform end to end tracking campaign results and resolve issues with the available resources.
Responsible for integrations between programmatic platforms/sales and ad serving systems.
Proven skills in ad trafficking and troubleshooting all revenue models of a campaign.
Liaise closely with sales team throughout campaigns, often on a day to day basis.
Knowledge on digital programmatic buying with hands-on experience using demand-side platforms for large-scale clients for a minimum of 2+ years. Preferred experience with using different DSPs.
Enthusiasm for the media industry and digital online industry.
Test and learn different optimization strategies and share knowledge with the team.
Skills & Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, advertising, math or a related field
2+ years of work experience
Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office Suite
Hands on experience with best ad servers & DSPs
Managing Display, Video & Native campaigns
Understanding of digital and advertising market
Positive attitude with a hunger to grow as a Master of their craft
Position Title : Programmatic Trader
Location : Bangalore, India
Department : Production
Hiring Manager : Associate Director - Programmatic Advertising
Compensation : Salary+Bonus

Title: Global Order Management & Care Project Management
Text:
Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) advances the way people live and work. We bring together curious minds to create breakthrough technology solutions, helping our customers make their mark on the world.
We’re solving the world’s most complex challenges, and our people are at the forefront of progress. In a Sales role at HPE, you’ll play a part in building the future—one big idea at a time. In the global Sales Operations team we are an exciting and dynamic organization responsible for driving the sales activities in support of our Customers, Partners and Sales teams as well as leading and defining the improvements to experiences to enable our continued growth. Working at HPE, you’ll have the resources to develop your talent and creativity. Are you ready for your next opportunity and to grow with us?
Your Role:
Develops, implements and utilizes processes and tools to enable the sales life-cycle (pricing, orders, invoicing, opportunity assessment, field inventory management and other sales pipeline analytics and forecasting solutions). Reports and analyzes order pipeline, bookings, revenue forecasting, revenue reporting, sales productivity and goal attainment. Maintains and enhances sales force automation systems, product/service costing models, and margin management tools/systems to effectively monitor and manage revenue/expenses.
Responsibilities:
Develops organization-wide architectures and methodologies for the design and implementation of processes and tools to provide sales forecasting, analytics and metrics, quotes and pricing, order management, invoicing, and operations support across multiple platforms and organizations within the Global Business Unit.
Consults with senior and executive business leaders to identify relevant analytics, standards and metrics for the assigned areas
Develops overall sales operations framework, including forecasts and budgets, to meet resource and sales client needs
Identifies and evaluates new technologies, process innovations, and partner relationships for alignment with strategy roadmap and business value
Creates plans for integration and update into sales operations architecture.
Leverages recognized domain expertise, business acumen, and experience to influence and guide decisions of executive business leadership, sales partners and customers.
Provides guidance and mentoring to less-experienced staff members to set an example of innovation and excellence.
Education and Experience Required:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Management or equivalent
Typically 10+ years experience
Knowledge and Skills:
Extensive experience designing and developing business-wide sales operations support systems and solutions
Excellent analytical, statistics and problem solving skills.
Extensive expertise in business and sales operations processes and their application to business-wide systems
Evaluating, selecting, and creating forms of forecasting and planning methodologies to develop guidance for deploying sales and operational resources and activities.
History of innovation with examples of developing new technologies and practices for quality systems
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
mastery in English and local language.
Ability to effectively communicate sales operations architectures, plans, proposals, and results, and negotiate options at business unit and executive levels.
Project Management / Six Sigma Certification desired
Agile certification desired
What we can offer you:
Extensive benefits, a competitive salary and participation in the shared values and purpose that make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers! At HPE, our goal is to provide equal opportunities, flexible work-life balance, and constantly evolving career growth.
If you are looking for challenges in an exciting, supportive and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Continue the conversation by clicking apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal at www.hpe.com/careers.
Join us and make your mark!
Find out more about us and follow us on:
https://www.facebook.com/HPECareers
https://twitter.com/HPE_Careers
HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together.

Title: Assistant Manager
Text:
Overview
Bank of America is one of the world’s leading financial institutions, serving individual consumers, small and middle-market businesses and large corporations with a full range of banking, investing, asset management and other financial and risk management products and services. We are committed to attracting and retaining top talent across the globe to ensure our continued success. Along with taking care of our customers, we want to be the best place for people to work and aim at creating a work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their goals.
We are a part of the Global Business Services which delivers technology and operations capabilities to all Bank of America lines of business (LOB) and enterprise functions.
Our employees help our customers and clients at every stage of their financial lives, helping them connect to what matters most. This purpose defines and unites us. Every day, we are focused on delivering value, convenience, expertise and innovation for individuals, businesses and institutional investors we serve worldwide.
BA Continuum is a nonbank subsidiary of Bank of America, part of Global Business Services in the bank.
Process Overview:
Building out Strategies, Analytics & Process Integration team in India driving improved fraud detection & loss reduction
Job Description:
In this role, you will be expected to look through significant quantities of data from various sources to identify and stop fraud.
Responsibilities
The role will be responsible for several key areas:
Development of new fraud strategies using analytical techniques including decision trees, random forests and other quantitative methods. Goal will be to identify and mitigate new and emerging fraud threats.
Identifying new sources of data (internal or vendor-provided) that can enrich our existing fraud detection processes, be added to our decision systems, and allow for new detection strategies to be developed. Will require close coordination with partners in Fraud Technology.
Optimization of existing detection strategies to determine areas where rules can be adjusted to decline fewer false positives and improve the ROI and overall performance of our fraud strategies
Review incoming trends and defects and make recommendations to change existing fraud rules
Candidate need to work on any of the given products - Credit Card / Debit Card / Deposit / Check /Reporting / ATO/New Accts/Digita
Requirements :
Mandatory Skills:
The candidate must have intermediate to advanced knowledge of SAS and SQL.
Must have 3 to 5 years of relevant experience in analytics. Strong preference working in financial services, particularly fraud or cyber security.
Candidate must have a proven track record of building and deploying analytical solutions that have resulted in material financial results.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment is critical.
Must have exceptional organizational, project management and communications skills.
Desired Skills:
Bachelor’s degree is desired, preferably in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, statistics, engineering, computer science, finance or business. Post graduate degree is a plus.
Familiarity with other programming languages such as Python, R or Java will be preferred.
Knowledge of data extraction tools such as Hive or HUE will be preferred.
Education / Certification:
Advanced degree, preferably in Statistics/Mathematics, Computer Sciences, Engineering from a premier institute
Technical certifications in SAS, SQL preferred
Experience:
3 to 5 years of relevant experience using SAS, SQL data analytics
U.S financial services experience preferable
Understanding of business domains like Fraud/Compliance/Risk preferable
Work Timings: 12: 30 PM to 9:30 PM
Job Location: Mumbai

Title: Accounting Operations Analyst
Text:
About Wells Fargo

Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading global financial services company with $2.0 trillion in assets and offices in over 37 countries. Founded in 1852 and headquartered in San Francisco, Wells Fargo provides asset management, capital raising and advisory, financing, foreign exchange, payments, risk management, and trade finance services to support customers who conduct business in the global economy. At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. We also value the viewpoints of our team members and encourage them to be their best. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you will feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. We are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Learn more at our International Careers website.

Market Job Description

About Wells Fargo India

Wells Fargo India enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and Knowledge Services. We are operating in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai locations. Learn more about Wells Fargo India at our International Careers website.

Department Overview

The Consumer, Small Business, and Wealth Investment Management (WIM) accounting teams are focused on providing excellent accounting support in the most efficient way possible for Business Units, such as Consumer Card, Consumer & Small Business Banking, Digital Platforms, Operations, and Wealth & Investment Management. The teams' primary responsibilities include ensuring proper general ledger (GL) accounting and complete and accurate financial reporting through robust, efficient processes and strong financial controls.

About the Role

This is an opportunity for a motivated accounting professional to join the Consumer, Small Business and Wealth Accounting team. This role requires a developed understanding of enterprise finance functional areas and responsible for internal financial management reporting to support the enterprise, working with business partners in conducting in-depth research of financial, operating and analyzing, interpreting and report findings.
Responsibilities
Day-to-day activities will vary but heavily oriented towards Deposits and Loan accounting, GL entries and correcting entries, Invoice management, GL Monitoring and adjustments and other Controllership activities.
Duties are accounting based operational processes, month-end and quarterly accounting/reviewing tasks, and special assignments
Reviewing GL and system of record data, completing research, analysis and eOne reconciliations
Preparing data for financial, SEC and regulatory reports
Performing detailed research of data and processes, analyzing, interpreting and reporting findings utilizing Excel, ESSBASE/Smartview and Financial reporting systems (Eagle Web, Oracle GL, IRIS Web, OBIEE)
Potential to providing functional advice and training to lower level accounting positions
Establishing effective preventative and detective internal controls structure to ensure accurate financial accounting and reporting
Establishing strong relationships with LOB partners and working closely to understand impacts
Building and maintaining End User Computer Tools (EUCT) and documentation
Essential Qualifications
Bachelor's/ Post graduate in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration
Minimum 4-6 years' experience in finance operations or accounting operations roles such as financial forecasting & reporting, monthly closing, forecasting and planning, financial planning analysis, cost allocation & costing, balance sheet, revenue & expense forecasting, transfer pricing, ALM & Treasury, reconciliation, capital markets, GL accounting, financial analytics & consulting, accounting reporting and Risk Reporting
Knowledge and understanding of accounting principles: statutory and GAAP
Knowledge and understanding of regulatory reporting: Federal Reserve, OCC, and SEC
Ability to work both independently and within team environment
Strong communication and presentation skills
Ability to perform complex analyses, build financial models, draw conclusions, and communicate recommendations to business leaders
Prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with critical deadlines
Advanced knowledge of Excel and Power point
Desired Qualifications
CA/(CPA) designation or candidate preferred
Public accounting audit experience a plus
Experience with data analytic tools (such as ESSBASE, SAS and/or SQL) & familiarity with Microsoft office products
Previous experience in creating/build models to perform analysis

We Value Diversity

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other status protected by applicable law. We comply with all applicable laws in every jurisdiction in which we operate.

Title: Global Billing Risk Management – Senior Manager (Officer)
Text:
Global Billing Risk Management – Senior Manager (Officer)
Basic Purpose of Job:
Global Billing Risk management is a newly established function which will be focused on developing, implementing and managing the Billing risk management in order to mitigate risk within the Global Billing function. The team’s scope of responsibility includes helping the Global Billing Operations team adhere to regulatory requirements, design controls and assess the gap and remediation plans, report issues and incidents and follow-up on the remediation plan. This is an opportunity to join a new function and actively participate in its development and maturity, to gain an understanding of Global Billing processes and learn about implementing a control environment.
Responsibilities & Tasks Include:
To understand and establish risks and related controls of the Global Billing Organization, including automated controls within business applications and add them to the Bank’s Risk management system.
Provide assist in the end to end incidents and issues management processes for billing:
Serve as reviewer of incidents and issues
Liaise with stakeholders to drive sustainable remediation of issues
Carry out monitoring activities around incidents and issues
Perform incident and issue analytic processes with a focus on understanding root cause and impacted controls / control gaps
Lead and/or actively participate in the resolution of systemic risk issues
Perform test of design and control evidence testing of the Global Billing Organization processes.
Build strong relationships with other teams including Global Billing Organization’s Management Team and the Finance Business Controls Team
Formally report the results of your work to VP whilst supporting the Global Head of Risk Management and other global Billing Risk Managers.
Develop expertise in Billing related controls, best practices and expectations
May be asked to participate in other activities within the team to support overall global billing risk management objectives and goals.
Job Requirements:
Education and Experience:
Chartered Accountant, MBA or CIA or Master’s degree in accounting, finance, economics, statistics, or a related field and 10+ years’ experience ideally covering the following:
Internal audit, Operational risk or Compliance or Big 4 experience
Experience in process and controls mapping methodologies, maintaining strong control environment (risk excellence, experience with SOX, RCSA controls, etc.), establishing policies, procedures and strong internal controls
Knowledge of Financial services or regulatory requirements in Finance- Controllers or Billing preferred
Skills/ Knowledge:
Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment
Highly organized with ability to multi-task and work under high pressure deadlines.
Must possess strong communication skills with ability to participate in or lead conference calls and reporting of issues to Management.
Business knowledge as it relates to the financial services industry, finance and billing processes.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, Visio), advanced levels of excel (pivot tables, formulas, excel workbook maintenance best practices)
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Self-motivated, self-assured, and self-managed
Results oriented ownership mindset and effectively manage timelines
Measure, review, and assess performance and progress towards goals
Attention to detail

Title: Market Insight Sr. Specialist
Text:
Sep 16, 2020
Client is in CT - work can be done remotely
Freelance
Agent: Kimberley S.
Job #: 161080
Salary: W2, Hourly, Depends on Experience
Job Description
Our client is seeking a consultant to support their Marketing Analytics and Strategy team and assist the organization in making quantitative-based decisions regarding the Medicare market, trends, competitors, potential and existing customers, ROI, and current campaigns.
Candidate should be proficient leading the creation of business intelligence data, concisely illustrating critical core Sales, Marketing, and Financial metrics, and developing other innovative ways to measure performance and forecast expected results. Candidate should also be comfortable working with large datasets and performing advanced data analysis & creating dashboards, as well as tools to facilitate reporting such as MS Access, SAS, Pivotal, and Tableau, along with complex MS Excel utilization including PowerPivot, Macros, Tables, etc. Other critical skill sets include the ability to work cross functionally, encouraging team participation and ideation, and presenting findings while being able to influence and read the audience.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Compile, prepare, and present to stakeholders and leadership analytical results with identification, quantification, and prioritization of opportunities. Reports may include detailed competitor analysis, campaign performance, sales projections and related KPI’s, etc.
Ability to leverage technical skillset in advanced statistical analysis and research methodologies to increase understanding of metrics correlation and impact on strategy and financial guidance
Identify and specify additional data necessary to execute innovative metrics required to understand the underlying performance of annual initiatives
Conducts secondary research, including finding information from industry associations, statisticians, and marketing experts to understand and quantify root-cause
Leads and/or facilitates the design, development, and implementation of new operational controls, performance metrics, information management systems, and automated processes
Strives to improve his/her skills and competencies and those of the team by demonstrating initiative and leadership in ongoing coaching and training programs
Compiles and analyzes results of services provided to organization for identification of improvement opportunities
Develops, produces, gathers, and improves executive and line-of-business dashboards and various adhoc requests
Implements and supports business intelligence activities utilizing data mining, reporting, and other intelligence methods and tools
Ensures all established internal reporting and business processes are fully documented with all internal and external quality audit requirements, such as approved P&P’s and Job Aides
Client Description:
Our national insurance industry client practices what it preaches, and has a strong health and wellness focus as part of their company culture. As a part of their organization, even as a freelancer, you can expect to be included in that culture!
What else can you expect from this organization?
As a congenial and collaborative culture, they’ll welcome you as an equal contributor, and value your opinion when it comes to creative and marketing project creation and delivery.
They’re fully committed to an Agile environment, adopting and utilizing standard Agile practices daily.
These folks are committed to getting it right, and as such, are quite focused on metrics and ROI. “Measure twice, cut once” is a common phrase that could possibly apply to their project teams. That’s why they value candidates with previous knowledge and experience in designing & managing to drive metrics, and have a keen eye for those with insurance industry experience.
Prior knowledge of and familiarity with industry acronyms is a plus.
This is very much a matrixed organization, so bring your A-game and communication skills! You’ll be networking with any number of stakeholders related to your creative and marketing projects.
Being a larger corporation, the meeting schedule is sometimes heavy. With a strong ability to stay organized and focused on your deliverable, you’ll thrive here!
Certain locations benefit from on-site fitness center facilities, Starbucks, and free parking. Our advice? Bring your walking shoes! Your day has a built in mini-workout. Parking in the CT facility tends to be a bit of a walk from the (very large!) main building, but that will make your fitness tracker happy!
Benefits for Consultants
Aquent talent are eligible for a generous health-and-wellness package.
Our plan includes: Medical Insurance Aquent offers access to comprehensive In and Out of Network plans, with contributions toward monthly premiums and often with eligibility within two months of starting work. Retirement Savings Plan Aquent offers a 401(k) plan, managed by a leader in the retirement field, with immediate vesting and employer match.
Other features:
Dental insurance
Vision insurance
Flexible spending accounts
Sick time
Professional training
Discounts and Perks
Requirements:
Desired Candidates will bring:
Bachelor’s or Postgraduate degree (MBA, MSA, MSBA) strongly preferred
Minimum of 4 years' experience performing analytical services
Proficient in using SQL, SAS, Tableau, and Excel
Strong knowledge and exposure/experience in healthcare operations or service roles (Marketing, Sales, Finance, Medical Economics, etc.)
Strong customer focus and track record of satisfied clients
Ideal candidate will be self-motivated, curious, and driven by ideas
An agile learner with the ability to develop and implement new processes and procedures
Leadership competencies with the ability to collaborate with others and establish working relationships, communicate effectively across the organization and at different levels, think and act strategically, and influence key leaders
Ability to work with a moderate level of guidance and direction
Leadership experience and exposure in presenting results and directing conversations
Successful candidates will be required to pass a drug test and background check prior to starting.

Title: FXEM Sales Assistant
Text:
FXEM Sales Assistant
Job Number:
3157355
POSTING DATE: Sep 16, 2020
PRIMARY LOCATION: Non-Japan Asia-India-Maharashtra-Mumbai (MSA)
EDUCATION LEVEL: Refer to Position Description
JOB: Investment Banking/Sales/Trading/Research
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Senior Associate
DESCRIPTION
From global institutions to hedge funds, investors come to Morgan Stanley for sales, trading, and market-making services in almost every type of financial instrument in all the world’s financial markets. Morgan Stanley professionals use our network and technology to provide liquidity and sophisticated analysis, to manage risk and execute reliably in the fast-changing markets.
The Fixed Income Division (FID) is comprised of Interest Rate and Currency Products, Credit Products and Distribution. Professionals in the Division assess and actively manage risk, trade securities, and structure as well as execute innovative transactions in the fast-paced and constantly changing global markets. The Securitized Products Group is a market leader across a broad range of asset classes including the residential real estate, commercial real estate, transportation and corporate sectors, with expertise in securitization, financing solutions, and other investor products.

The Global Markets Group (GMG) is the offshoring arm of Morgan Stanley’s Sales & Trading businesses in India. It covers functions across FID and Institutional Equities Division (IED) ranging from those associated with sales, trading, analytics, strats to risk management.
The role is based out of Mumbai and requires working with the FXEM UK Institutional Sales team in London. The role will require a fast-learning, dynamic, pro-active, communicative person with exceptional attention to detail to assist the team in optimizing efficiency around client business.
The role involves
Daily data reports: Using FX options system to pull reports on expiries, market data, and proximity of barriers to distribute to relevant sales teams.
Client Revenue reporting: Prepare regular reports for senior distribution management highlighting revenue performance and momentum including tracking hit ratios across all FX products. Ensure trader revenue is accurately reflected against the client and salesperson. Preparing detailed reports for the desk heads providing color on revenue, interactions and client coverage.
On-Boarding: Assisting the sales teams with new on-boarding requests, liaising with internal stake-holders and ensuring seamless start to finish approach to on-boarding new accounts. Working with internal teams to open new FX accounts, ensuring new on-boarded accounts are set up correctly in internal systems and mapped to the relevant sales person.
Global role: Working with other SA to ensure seamless handover of trade bookings and amendments for the Global FXEM sales teams. This includes booking and allocating trades accurately and responding to follow ups from internal teams or the client on allocations or fixing queries.
Post Trade Process: Working towards creating long term solutions to recurring administrative themes to help team efficiency.
Presentations & Marketing Materials: Supporting the desks and desks heads in putting together briefing notes or presentations ahead of internal and client meetings.
QUALIFICATIONS
The basic skills required for the role are the ability to learn quickly how to navigate databases, manipulate data from these confidently in Excel and respond to requests promptly.

Skill set required:
We are looking for a confident and outgoing person, who has exceptional attention to detail and is proactive in taking initiative. Successful candidates will have a proven work experience analyzing data.

Graduate MBA with 2- 3 years of experience
Excellent written & spoken English; Excellent business writing skills
Excellent telephone and communication skills (regular phone contact with team and internal stakeholders required)
Advanced knowledge and extensive hands‑on experience with Microsoft Office - Word, Excel including macros, PowerPoint.
Familiarity with databases, and the ability to manipulate/analyze data confidently
Experience/exposure to FX markets and systems (FXConnect, Electronic platforms) will be valuable.
Strong analytical skills
Attention to detail
Team work
Problem solving
