Title: Finance Processes-Budgeting and Forecasting
Text:
Job Description
Job Skill: Budgeting and Forecasting
Designation: Career Level - 12-Associate
Job Location: Gurugram
Qualifications: Chartered Accountant/Master of Business Administration
Years of Experience: 1-3 years
About Accenture
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries - powered by the world's largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises. Visit us at www.accenture.com

Job Summary
You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions.
You will be working as a part of Finance Processes team. The team is responsible for identifing new cross-sell opportunities, cutting report cycle time, increasing reporting accuracy and improves cash and capital forecasting. This team uses financial planning, reporting, variance analysis, budgeting and forecasting to help clients and organizations exercise and imply financial control.
The Budgeting & Forecasting team focuses on managing, coordinating and driving the finance and planning activities of the business which includes strategy development and implementation. The team is responsible for the preparation of budget, forecasting, cost analysis, variance analysis, Full Time Equivalent (FTE) headcount analysis and financial reporting.
Good to have skills: Financial Tracking and Reporting,Financial Analysis,Program and Project Management,Good communication skills,Effectively collaboration and team work,Ability to solve problems,Presentation skills,Analytic skills
Roles and Responsibilities
In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines. Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor. You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments. The decisions that you make would impact your own work. You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work. Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts.

Qualifications
Chartered Accountant/Master of Business Administration

Title: Institutional Business Development Manager - South Asia
Text:
Position Summary: Institutional Business Development Manager - South Asia
The Trimble’s Emerging Markets and Funded Projects division represents a number of business areas, from a number of sectors. The firm is looking to recruit, in the South Asia region, an experienced Institutional Business Development Manager to focus on Multilateral Development Bank (MDB) Funded Projects and Consultants working within these projects that may involve products from the complete Trimble portfolio. This position will provide specific sales and management focus on activities connected with data gathering, tender preparation, tender execution, and relationship development with related consultants and agencies personnel, within the business development, Emerging Markets and Funded Projects team. This individual will have direct sales responsibility in all of South Asia region for his/her nominated Projects.
Familiar with the engineering and construction industry, technology aware/skilled; Business experience; demonstrate competence in relational sales; international exposure; responsible and accountable positions held within the last two years; culturally aware; able to travel internationally (60%+). Desired familiarity with MDBs and other regional active funding organizations.
He/she will report to the Vice President & Executive Director - Emerging Markets and Funded Projects.
Major Responsibilities
· Lead account and project development opportunities generated through the funding agencies. These include, but are not limited to corporate partners and customers, distribution partners, multilateral agencies, US and foreign government entities for the Geospatial, Agriculture, Water, Land Administration, Fleet Management, Construction, and Utilities businesses.
Build relationships with Bilateral/Multilateral Development Organizations such as the World Bank, United Nations and Asian Development Bank.
Fluent in written and oral English and one other regional language, common to Trimble’s business is preferred.
· Public speaking experience, strong presentation skills
Education requirements:
· (MS/MBA) Graduate Degree in international business, international relations, foreign service or technical area required
Experience requirements (years):
· Five years of international experience in business development in fast pace, multicultural environments
· Two years + sales/business development or account management or project management experience
· Two years + experience in one or more of the following industries: government public policy, multilateral development banks, development consulting, surveying, mapping, engineering, construction, mining, agriculture.
Trimble is transforming the way the world works by delivering products and services that connect the physical and digital worlds. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics enable customers to improve productivity, quality, safety and sustainability. From purpose built products to enterprise lifecycle solutions, Trimble software, hardware and services are transforming a broad range of industries such as agriculture, construction, geospatial and transportation and logistics.
Those who successfully lead others to meet our objectives are vital to our organization. Leadership at Trimble is much more than simply exercising assigned authority; we expect our leaders to embrace a mission-focused leadership style, by continually adapting to circumstances while not losing sight of the end goal; demonstrating strength of character, intellect and the ability to convert ideas to reality.

If you want to join an innovative team that creates ground breaking market disrupting product and enjoy serving customers then send a copy of your complete resume with a subject line “Patent Associate”. We are seeking a skilled and experienced Patent Associate to support and handle our Patent related works. You will work closely with our attorneys from the beginning of a case through the end, including if it goes to trial. You also need to have excellent research skills, be able to multitask several assignments under tight deadlines, and be proficient in Microsoft Office and the country’s law.
PatentAssociate Duties and Responsibilities:
Our needs are primarily around:
Drafting the Patents.
Patent/trademark application preparation.
Performing patent/trademark research.
Managing and maintaining IP.
Managing communication with the legal team and enforcing company IP rights.
Managing communication with law enforcement for supporting legal proceedings whenever needed.
PatentAssociate Requirements and Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in science or other technical backgrounds (B.Sc. / M.Sc. / B. Tech / M. Tech) in any specialization.
Grammatically correct English writing for the North American audience is a must.
Must have expertise in Patent Services, Patent Analytic, and Design Registration.
Must have good knowledge of IPR.
Proficient in Microsoft Office and Microsoft Office and the country law.
Excellent communication (both verbal and written) and organization skills.
Required min. 3 years of experience in the same field.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: Up to ₹500,000.00 per year
Experience:
patent drafting: 3 years (Preferred)
USPTO application: 1 year (Preferred)
Education:
Bachelor's (Required)

Title: Marketing Internship
Text:
About the company:
GreedyGame is building mobile-first advertising solutions. We are a platform that enables blending of ads within mobile apps and games so that they become a part of the content. This allows developers to monetize their apps and games without degrading the user experience.
About the internship/job:
Selected intern's day-to-day responsibilities include: 1. Work on lead nurturing - once a lead is acquired, the lead needs to be nurtured to ensure we shorten their conversion path to our product and handhold them throughout the onboarding journey 2. Work on account management - frontend interaction with the client with the responsibility of overall account growth (across multiple products). This includes finding business opportunities for cross-sell/up-sell etc. across the product portfolio 3. Work on ad strategy consulting - consult publishers with ad monetization strategies and app promotion strategies to be implemented for overall profit growth 4. Work on business analysis - multiple data signals are gathered across a large set of business tools such as ad-monetization reports, analytics reports (firebase), CRM tools, and GreedyGame SDK signals. You will learn how to make sense of data gathered across tools to take critical business decisions
Who can apply:
Only those students or freshers can apply who:
are available for full time (in-office) internship
have relevant skills and interests
can start the internship between 15th Sep'20 and 20th Oct'20
are available for duration of 3 months
have already graduated or are currently in any year of study
Females willing to start/restart their career may also apply
Other requirements:
Engineering graduates from premier Institutes - IITs/BITS/NITs Strong communication and presentation skills Analytical skills English proficiency (spoken and written) Manage pressure and work through tight timelines Show a high learning curve towards new technologies, tools, and techniques Implement precise strategies towards goals and see them through Ability to differentiate the clutter from the relevant and pick up skills through self-learning in the age of information overload
Number of internships/jobs available: 2
Categories: Marketing,Sales,MBA
